source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_042_chunk1
evidence_span: small specimens (60 by 10 by 1 mm) are attached to holders inside hollow fuel elements and irradiated within a Materials Test Bundle (MOB) capable of delivering a fast-neutron flux (E > 1 MeV) of about 5 × 10¹⁷ n/m²·s
process_step: hot extrusion at 1090 K, cold drawing 20-30%, stress relieving at 673 K for 24 h
conditions: temperature: 568 K, fast-neutron flux: 5×10¹⁷ n/m²·s, water chemistry: controlled

extra_properties.microstructure: slightly elongated grains of single phase α-Zr containing a distribution of second-phase intermetallic particles

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_042_chunk1

conditions: temperature: 568 K, fast-neutron flux: 5×10¹⁷ n/m²·s, water chemistry: controlled

extra_properties.microstructure: two-phase, consisting of elongated α-Zr grains surrounded by a β-Zr network
